column5: If any of you folks are just leaving home and plan on going across the Gardner, it was just reported that it's closed both ways between Yonge & Spadina because of large sheets of ice blowing down from the CN Tower  This'll be another traffic nightmare
It's days like today that I'm sure retirement is all that much sweeter, eh Lew
You got that right Jim, the only traffic jam I ever see is on the morning news on TV
Maybe one day they will clear this mess up once and for all.

Yeah, I seen on the news the size of these sheets coming down, wow, they are huge.  Easily can cause severe damage, or death.  Hopefully they can figure out something because this appears to be happening every year.
We are in the process of rebranding the CN tower from the "Tallest free-standing structure"  to "the world's tallest popsicle"
Some footage from City TV here.  http://www.citynews.ca/news/features_8415.aspx
a peice flew off of a skyscraper and shattered a taxi's rear window..
